header.title: Guidelines for Contributors to the Australian Journal of Parapsychology

central_thesis: This document outlines the scope, submission requirements, stylistic preferences, and review process for papers submitted to the Australian Journal of Parapsychology, aiming to guide potential contributors.

structure_content.summary: The journal welcomes theoretical or experimental papers on paranormal topics like extra-sensory perception, psychokinesis, and life after death, considering all submissions. It explicitly states it is not a 'New Age' or religious journal and aims for articles accessible to the intelligent layperson, typically including at least one technical article per issue.

Contributors are asked to follow the style and format exemplified in the journal, which adheres to the American Psychological Association (APA) style. Theoretical or experimental papers must include an abstract and a reference section compliant with this style. Australian spelling is preferred over American spelling.
All submissions, with the exception of book reviews and correspondence, undergo a peer-review process to ensure academic rigor and quality.

Further details regarding submissions can be found on the journal's website (www.aiprinc.org/journal.asp). Contributions can be sent via email attachments to lance.storm@adelaide.edu.au or by postal mail to Dr. Lance Storm at the School of Psychology, University of Adelaide, Adelaide SA 5005, AUSTRALIA.

key_concepts.definition: Topics including extra-sensory perception, psychokinesis, and life after death, which are welcomed for theoretical or experimental papers in the journal.
The style and format authorized by the American Psychological Association, which contributors are required to follow for their submissions, particularly for abstracts and reference sections.
The process by which all submissions, excluding book reviews and correspondence, are evaluated by independent experts in the field to ensure quality and validity.
A core aim of the journal to present articles that are understandable and engaging for a general educated audience, while still including technical content.

practical_system.description: The practical system for contributing to the Australian Journal of Parapsychology involves crafting theoretical or experimental papers on paranormal topics. These papers must adhere to APA style for formatting, including an abstract and reference section, and should use Australian spelling. Submissions are generally peer-reviewed, and can be sent via email or postal mail.

relevant_quotes.text: The Australian Journal of Parapsychology welcomes theoretical or experimental papers on all topics to do with the paranormal, including extra-sensory perception, psychokinesis, and life after death.
Note, however, that we are not a 'New Age' or religious journal.
Our basic aim is to present articles that are accessible to the intelligent layperson, although we usually have at least one technical article in each issue.
all submissions, other than book reviews and correspondence, are peer-reviewed.
Note that we use Australian rather than American spelling.

critical_analysis.relevance: This document is highly relevant for individuals intending to publish research or theoretical articles within the specific academic field of parapsychology, providing direct guidance on journal expectations and submission procedures.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of academic researchers, scholars, and practitioners in parapsychology who are seeking to publish their work in a peer-reviewed journal. It also caters to those generally interested in the editorial policies of academic publications in this field.
